title: Cooper wins PFA Fans' award
text:
Millwall's Jake Cooper wins PFA Fans' League One Player of the Month for February Last Updated: 07/03/17 10:57pm Jake Cooper of Millwall has been named as the PFA Fans' League One Player of the Month for February Millwall defender Jake Cooper has won the PFA Fans' League One Player of the Month award for February. 
The defender picked up the prize for his performances in January after collecting 6,930 votes from the public. 
Billy Sharp of Sheffield United finished a close second with 6,197 votes with Bradford's Charlie Wyke third with 1,152 votes following a poll on Sky Sports' digital platforms. 
Josh Wright of Gillingham (942 votes), Marc-Antoine Fortune of Southend (354 votes) and Conor McAleny of Oxford (332 votes) were also shortlisted for the PFA Fans' Player of the Month award. 
The shortlist was chosen by our panel, which included Sky Sports pundits Paul Merson and Peter Beagrie, Mike Riley - general manager of the Professional Game Match Officials and Malcolm Clarke - chairman of the Football Supporters' Federation. 
One voting fan in each division will win the chance to meet and present the award to each PFA' Fans' Player of the Month. Also See:
